intro: Heterotis laevis, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces woody capsules that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Heterotis laevis is valued for its ornamental beauty and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
